CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper May 4, 1946, pg. 14, reads: "They're Pals Now - Alfred Cleveland, Fifth Avenue High School student (left), shakes hands with John Fuimara [Fiumara] of Dinwiddie Street, in the office of James Robinson, Hill City director, following a dispute which reportedly almost caused a riot near Fifth Avenue School last Thursday evening. Robinson looks on as the two boys make up. Both youths said they knew nothing about the riot rumors which had circulated throughout the district. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Hill City Director James Robinson watching Alfred Cleveland and John Fuimara or Fiumara shake hands after dispute, in Robinson's office with Red Cross flags in background
